pr_title: Convert traditional null checks to use Utils.validateNotNull

timeline.message: Converts traditional null checks to use Objects.requireNonNull where applicable. Issue #1387.
Add two static methods to the Utils class that check object reference for nullity. Issue #1387.
Modify the static methods validateNotNull to throw an IllegalArgumentException instead of a NullpointerException, if specified object reference is null. Issue #1387.
Refactor static methods validateNotNull in Utils class. Issue #1387.
Convert traditional null checks to use Utils.validateNotNull. Issue #1387

Remove unused import in Utils class.
Revert back to using traditional null check in Broker constructor, due to failed checks.
Refactor static validateNotNull methods in Utils class to comply to style rules.

timeline.bodyText:
I think this is exactly the case where the lazy-evaluation validateNotNull(T obj, Supplier<String> errorMsgSupplier) method needs to be used since in the previous version, "The destination broker cannot be null for balancing action " + this does not get executed unless _destinationBrokerId == null is true. So, the change should be:
validateNotNull(_destinationBrokerId, () -> "The destination broker cannot be null for balancing action " + this);

timeline.bodyText: Same issue: _uuid  = validateNotNull(uuid, "UUID of the execution cannot be null.");
timeline.author: Lincong

timeline.message:
Use lazy evaluation when error message is dynamically generated in ValidateNotNull method.
Use the return value from the validateNotNull method directly where applicable.
Issue #1387
